Educational program that teaches individuals how to perform CPR in the event of cardiac emergencies.', 'Defibrillator** - A device that delivers an electric shock to restore normal heart rhythm in case of cardiac arrest.', 'AED (Automated External Defibrillator)** - A portable device that automatically analyzes heart rhythm and delivers a shock if necessary.', 'First Aid** - Basic medical care provided at the scene of an emergency until professional medical help arrives.', 'Emergency Medical Services (EMS)** - Trained medical professionals who provide emergency medical care to patients in the field.', 'Medical Emergency** - Any sudden or severe medical condition that requires immediate attention.', 'Cardiac Arrest** - Sudden loss of heart function that can lead to unconsciousness and potentially death.', "Vital Signs** - Measurements of body temperature, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure used to assess the patient's condition.", 'Emergency Procedure** - A predefined sequence of actions taken in the event of a medical emergency.', "Patient Stabilization** - Measures taken to maintain the patient's vital signs and prevent further complications.", 'Medical Dispatch** - Service that receives and routes emergency medical calls to the appropriate responders.', 'Code Blue** - A signal indicating a cardiac emergency requiring immediate attention.', 'Emergency Response Team** - Group of trained professionals who respond to medical emergencies.', 'Patient Transfer** - Transportation of a patient from the scene of an emergency to a healthcare facility.', 'Emergency Care Unit (ECU)** - Specialized medical facility for treating urgent medical conditions.', 'Trauma Center** - Hospital department equipped to handle severe injuries and emergencies.', 'Critical Care Unit (CCU)** - Unit where patients with life-threatening medical conditions receive intensive care.', 'Emergency Response Plan** - Comprehensive plan outlining procedures and resources to respond effectively to medical emergencies.']
